title: John Barrowman urges LGBTQ community to support Dancing On Ice same sex pairing
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

John Barrowman has called on the LGBTQ+ community to fully support the same sex pairing on the new series of Dancing On Ice.

Steps singer Ian ‘H’ Watkins has been paired with professional ice skater Matt Evers for the new series, and John, who is a judge on the 2020 series, praised ITV for the ‘amazing’ decision.

Appearing on This Morning, the actor also responded to criticism he had seen questioning the decision of pairing two men.

He told hosts Holly Willoughby and Phillip Schofield: ‘I think it’s amazing, and congratulations to Dancing On Ice and ITV for being the first in the UK to have same sex partners.

‘I don’t know if it’s around the world but I’m pretty sure it probably is.

‘I think one thing…we all just now have to sit back a little bit because, I’ve followed stuff online and there’s been a little controversy of why is it two men, why is it this, why is it that?

Matt Evers and Ian ‘H’ Watkins will make history on Dancing On Ice (Picture: Rex)

‘You know what, it’s a same sex partnership. It’s the first. Let’s do it this way, be supportive as a community, the LGBTQ community and everybody else.

‘Let’s be supportive of this and let’s see how they do. Let’s see if they’re gonna be good.’

H meanwhile has had plenty of support in response, and recently thanked fans for showing the love.

Shortly after the news of the Dancing On Ice pairing broke, he shared a selfie on Instagram with the message: ‘Totally overwhelmed today… I’ll need some time to just take it all in!!

Steps singer H reportedly asked to be matched with a male professional (Picture: ITV)

‘I’m just totally blown away by your incredible support and messages! Thank you so much, truly xx.’

A source told Metro.co.uk that H had asked Dancing On Ice bosses whether he could be matched with a professional of the same gender.

‘After conversations with the Dancing on Ice production team, H enquired as to the possibility of being paired with a male pro skater,’ they said.

‘Dancing on Ice were fully supportive of a same-sex partnership and as such this year H will be paired with Matt Evers.’

Dancing On Ice returns for a new series in the new year.

This Morning airs weekdays from 10.30am on ITV.
